item.title: Nvidia AI Chips to Undergo Unusual U.S. Security Review Before Export to China
item.description: Shipping chips from Taiwan to the U.S. to China would allow government to get 25% cut of sales.

item.title: How Trump’s U-Turn on Nvidia Chips Changes the Game for China’s AI
item.description: President Trump’s deal instantly reshaped the U.S.-China technological Cold War. The fear among his critics is he just helped Beijing catch up.

item.title: Opinion | Trump Says Chips Ahoy to Xi Jinping
item.description: Why is he giving an adversary access to advanced AI semiconductors—and for what in return?

item.title: EU Launches In-Depth Foreign Subsidies Probe Into China’s Nuctech
item.description: The bloc said Nuctech might have received grants, preferential tax measures and loans which could have improved its competitive position in Europe.

item.title: Mexico Slaps Up to 50% Tariffs on Chinese Goods, Drawing Outcry From Beijing
item.description: Lawmakers pass levies targeting countries that Mexico has no trade agreement with, including China.

item.title: China Vows to Boost Domestic Demand
item.description: Chinese officials pledged to prioritize supporting domestic demand in their policy road map for 2026.

item.title: China’s AI Power Play: Cheap Electricity From World’s Biggest Grid
item.description: Government push for power supremacy transforms Inner Mongolia. Tech leaders worry about a U.S.-China “electron gap.”

item.title: China Is Too Big to Rely on Exports for Growth, IMF Chief Warns
item.description: On a visit to Beijing, the economist urged the government to get people spending more.

item.title: China’s Manufacturing Is Booming Despite Trump’s Tariffs
item.description: U.S. pressure has only cemented its rival’s status as the world’s indispensable factory floor, sending its trade surplus above $1 trillion.

item.title: Chinese Forces Battle Dizzying Altitudes to Expand Military Footprint
item.description: A Wall Street Journal analysis of more than 100 satellite images shows clear evidence of the country’s expanding air power and reach.
